questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI fabric must back up the current configuration to a remote FTP server. Which set of actions automatically triggers the created policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
By creating an export policy and a scheduler policy, and setting the maximum concurrent node value appropriately, you ensure that backups are automated and performed efficiently without overloading the system.

choices.A:
Create two export policies.
Create two scheduler policies.
Set the maximum concurrent node value to 1.
choices.B:
Create an import policy.
Create two scheduler policies.
Set the maximum concurrent node value to 2.
choices.D:
Create two import policies.
Create a scheduler policy.
Set the maximum concurrent node value to 2.
choices.C:
Create an export policy.
Create a scheduler policy.
Set the maximum concurrent node value to 1.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
apic1(config)# vpc domain ?
 consecutive Pair all discovered leaves consecutively e.g. 101-102, 103-104
 explicit Pair two leaf nodes explicitly
 reciprocal Pair all discovered leaves reciprocally e.g. 101-103, 102-104

Selected Answer: C
Reciprocal:Automatically pairs switches in a reciprocal manner

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI fabric has 10 standalone leaf switches. The requirement is for the APIC to select the odd switches as a VPC group and select even switches as another VPC group automatically. Which VPC protection type must be configured to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In a Cisco ACI Multi-Pod deployment, the Inter-Pod Network (IPN) provides Layer 2 and Layer 3 connectivity across pods and physical locations. The IPN is a routed network that connects the spine switches of different pods, enabling communication between them. It facilitates the exchange of endpoint information and ensures seamless connectivity across the fabric, even when pods are geographically dispersed.

Selected Answer: B
It is the use of the VXLAN overlay technology in the data-plane that provides seamless Layer 2 and Layer 3 connectivity services between endpoints, independently from the physical location (Pod) where they are connected.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/white-paper-c11-737855.html

comments.content: Nonetheless, the IPN must simply provide basic Layer 3 connectivity services, allowing for the establishment across Pods of spine-to-spine and leaf-to-leaf VXLAN tunnels. It is the use of the VXLAN overlay technology in the data-plane that provides seamless Layer 2 and Layer 3 connectivity services between endpoints, independently from the physical location (Pod) where they are connected.

discussion.content:
It's A
At the same time, seamless Layer 2 and Layer 3 connectivity services can be provided between endpoints independently from the physical location where they are connected and without requiring any specific functionality from the network interconnecting the various Pods.

Selected Answer: A
It must be Interpod Network

questions.question_text: Which component provides Cisco ACI fabric with Layer 2 and Layer 3 connectivity across pods and physical locations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To force the subnet 10.1.0.0/24 to populate in the routing table for VRF-1 in the described scenario, the engineer must set the "Import Route Control Subnet" scope on the external EPG subnet.
The "Import Route Control Subnet" scope is used to control which external routes are imported into the ACI fabric's routing table. This option becomes available when the L3Out has "Import Route Control Enforcement" enabled, which is the case in this scenario

Selected Answer: A
To force the subnet 10.1.0.0/24 to populate in the routing table for VRF-1 in the described scenario, the engineer must set the "Import Route Control Subnet" scope on the external EPG subnet.

questions.question_text: An engineer configures an L3Out in VRF-1 that was configured for Import Route Control Enforcement. The L3Out uses OSPF to peer with a core switch. The L3Out has one external EPG, and it has been configured with a subnet 10.1.0.0/24. Which scope must be set to force 10.1.0.0/24 to populate in the routing table for VRF-1?

discussion.content: "Limit IP learning to subnet" setting within the bridge domain.

Selected Answer: D
"Limit Local IP Learning to BD/EPG Subnet(s)" checkbox in 6.0 > correct!

Selected Answer: D
"Limit Local IP Learning to BD/EPG Subnet(s)" checkbox in 6.0

Selected Answer: D
D. "Limit IP learning to subnet" setting within the bridge domain.

questions.question_text: Which setting prevents the learning of Endpoint IP addresses whose subnet does not match the bridge domain subnet?

choices.B: "Limit IP learning to subnet" setting within the EPG.
choices.C: "Limit IP learning to network" setting within the EPG.
choices.D: "Limit IP learning to subnet" setting within the bridge domain.
choices.A: "Limit IP learning to network" setting within the bridge domain.
